Isn’t  this  all  fantasy  too?  Of  course*—but  it  is  no  more  the  product  of
speculative imagination than Behe’s seemingly plausible assumption that
the components of the flagellum would have had to be added one by one,
and  would  have  sat  around  idly  (at  best)  until  the  culminating  moment
when all were present. Moreover, we were supposed to be offered a proof of
impossibility,  and  that  won’t  be  complete  until  Behe  and  his  allies  have
shown t
